When this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« was spoken, those buddhas, the world-honored ones, praised it, saying:ğŸ”½Excellent!

You have now spoken this profound dhÄraá¹‡Ä«.
If there are those who read, recite, and uphold this dhÄraá¹‡Ä«, always contemplating it extensively,
those sons of good family will attain the constant fulfillment of their wishes by these buddhas, the world-honored ones.
At that time, the TathÄgata Fragrant Light covered the trichiliocosm with his tongue, and then said to the seventy-seven koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of bodhisattvas:

'If there are sons and daughters of good family who uphold, recite, and chant these dhÄraá¹‡Ä« phrases, and make offerings according to their ability, they will fulfill all the wishes in their hearts for these buddhas and world-honored ones.'
At that time, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva Teachings and Enlightenment addressed the TathÄgata Fragrant Light, saying:
'World-Honored One!
How should they make offerings to those buddhas and world-honored ones?'
Having said this, the World-Honored One told the bodhisattva Teachings and Enlightenment:

'If a good family son or daughter who has first generated the mind of enlightenment and is practicing the initial stages of the bodhisattva, and who also wishes to fulfill all their wishes, they should in the morning smear the ground with cow dung, make offerings of incense and flowers according to their ability, avoid worldly talk, recite the names of those buddhas and this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« three times during the day and three times at night, and they will then be able to directly perceive all dharmas, gradually eliminate all karmic hindrances, by the true upholding of the tathÄgatas.

Homage to the TathÄgata Moonlight. TadyathÄ: 1. Jandari, 2. Jandari, 3. Sojandari, 4. Modajandari, 5. Jandari-garani, 6. Mili mili, 7. Budhadhisthite, 8. Caturcaturdharmadisthite, 9. SvÄhÄ. If there are good men and good women who, in the early morning, always diligently and single-mindedly recollect the names of those TathÄgatas, then for forty thousand eons they will always remember their past lives and will not forget the mind of enlightenment.

Homage to the TathÄgata of Purity in All Destinies TadyathÄ: Å›odhani Å›odhani Å›odhani, sarvapÄpaviÅ›odhani viÅ›odhani, sarvadharmasvabhÄvaÅ›odhani svÄhÄ If any good sons or good women are always able to uphold the names of these TathÄgatas, diligently recollecting them without forgetting, they will immediately attain direct perception of all dharmas, exhaust all karmic hindrances and all evils. By the power of the true empowerment of the Buddhas, for fourteen koá¹­Ä«s of eons they will always remember their past lives, and even up to enlightenment, their wholesome roots will not be exhausted.

Homage to the TathÄgata Pure Eyes TathÄgata Jhaká¹£u jhaká¹£u Jhaká¹£u If good sons and good women uphold the name of this TathÄgata, they will become eyes for the world, always able to remember the events of forty koá¹­Ä«s of past lives, up to the place of enlightenment, and their wholesome roots will not be exhausted.
Homage to the TathÄgata Fragrant Elephant Light King TathÄgata Ghaá¹­e ghaá¹­e Ghaá¹­e dá¹›á¹£á¹­i At that time, the Bodhisattva Victorious Accumulation said to the Buddha:

If good sons and good women uphold the name of this TathÄgata Fragrant Elephant Light King, for thirteen koá¹­Ä«s of years, a fragrant scent will constantly emanate from their bodies without interruption, and they will not forget the thought of enlightenment.
Homage to the TathÄgata Flower Appearance TadyathÄ: budh-budh-budha-su budha svÄhÄ This dhÄraá¹‡Ä« has many functions.

Using this dhÄraá¹‡Ä«, enchant flowers twenty-one times, and scatter them in the TathÄgata's stÅ«pa according to the preparations. All the wishes of that person will be fulfilled, and all karmic hindrances will be exhausted.

Homage to the TathÄgata King of Taming the Earth TadyathÄ: dhari dhari dharani bandha svÄhÄ If a person upholds the name of this TathÄgata and this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« verse, all the wishes of that person will be fulfilled.

Recite this mantra one hundred and eight times, and then all places will be bound by the boundary. Using whatever offerings are available, make offerings to the TathÄgata, and all wishes will be fulfilled.
